concept.title: The href attribute in a topic references
concept.shortdesc: A topic reference (topicref) in a ditamap references the topic (or other resource) to be included in the output publication through the href attribute. The value of the href attribute must conform to the standard URI format.

conbody.p: Topic reference (topicref) elements usually reference a DITA topic, but can also reference external resources such as Web sites. The resources being referenced in topicref element are specified in the href attribute.

section.title: Rationale

lq.reftitle: Deborah Pickett, Yahoo! DITA Users Group

section.lq: DITA does not speak in terms of file paths. It knows only URLs. When you use a DITA document it is mandatory that you use URLs. Hence, as David said, don't say "c:\My Documents", say "file:/c:/My%20Documents". Don't say "\\server\share", say "smb://server/share".
